paper.title: Extracting the correlation structure by means of planar embedding
paper.abstract: The hierarchical structure of correlation matrices in complex systems is studied by extracting a significant sub-set of correlations resulting in a planar graph. Such a graph has been generated by a method introduced in Aste et al.(1) and it has the same hierarchical structure of the Minimum Spanning Tree but it contains a larger amount of links, loops and cliques. In Tumminello et al.,2 we have shown that this method, applied to a financial portfolio of 100 stocks in the USA equity markets, is pretty efficient in filtering relevant information about the system clustering revaling the hierarchical organization in the whole system and within each cluster. Here we discuss this filtering correlation procedure and its application to different financial data sets.

domain_result.justification: 该论文研究了相关性矩阵的层次结构，并应用于美国股市100只股票的投资组合，旨在过滤相关信息并揭示系统的聚类和层次组织。这直接关联到投资组合管理中资产相关性分析和组合优化的核心问题。
